content: **aspen fingerless gloves** the aspen fingerless gloves are a simple and very quick project that pairs perfectly with any of the patterns from the aspen collection the entire collection is designed for warmth and functionality each piece is made up of crochet ribbing stitches to give them a classic and gender neutral look they all work up quickly making them great for gifts or for building craft fair inventory i used some of the same stitches and design elements in the cypress collection so that the two collections could be used together to create unique and coordinating sets the pattern calls for bulky weight 5 yarn or two strands of worsted/aran weight 4 yarn mine are made with two strands of lion brand re-tweed yarn which is a heavier weight 4 it is labeled a worsted however it works up more like an aran weight i recommend choosing a heavier weight 5 or aran weight yarn be sure to check your gauge to get a good fit a combination of ribbing stitches in these gloves helps shape them so that the wrists are more snug insuring a secure fit the ribbing also makes them stretchy so they are one size fits most after meeting gauge the finished size of each glove should be approximately 8 long 4 1/2 wide across the hand and 3 wide at the wrist there are written instructions as well as photo tutorials for the foundation single_crochet and the foundation half double crochet stitches there are also written instructions for finding the back loop of a stitch and a photo tutorial for seaming the edges together written in english using u s terms **what you need ** yarn - worsted - approx 150 yds bulky - approx 75 yds hooks - u s j/6 mm or any hook to meet gauge needle for weaving in ends scissors yarns tested for this pattern lion brand hue and me bulky 80% acrylic 20% wool lion brand re-tweed worsted/aran 40% wool 40% polyester 20% acrylic 202 yds/skein find me and sign up for emails at https //www winterwooldesigns com/
